title: When you're recording a song, how do you record both video and audio at the same time? - Quora

response.answer_text: Your going to need a field recorder with enough inputs for each instrument being played. The drums are going to need a separate mic for each piece set them pointed at the source of the sound about 6 inches away at a very low vilume(check with headphones) same with any amplifier. Then set you camera up with a steady cam or tripod or however your going to film it. Finally in an audio program put the audio file and the video files in rough order and drag the files around until the audio is in sync. An easier way to do this is when your ready to film use a clap board. Start the video recording clap the board into one of the mics at a point where the camera can see you doing it and that exact point on the audio will make a sharp wave form and you will know exactly where to move the audio around to sync it.

Using Audacity may be a good option. This is a free-to-use and open-source audio editing program, so it won’t cost you any money. To use it to record audio from a video, just open the recording feature on Audacity, then play the video you want to record. After you finish recording, use its editing tools to crop the recorded audio and do any editing you want. To learn how to do this in detail, you may want to see this post. Its second section helps you know how to record audio with Audacity on a Windows computer.
